ResourceHeader.Description: SPASE resource metadata can contain textual content that describe the resource. While descriptive text may be brief some formatting of the text may be necessary to convey the necessary information. A principal of the SPASE data model is that an element may contain a value or other elements. Mixed content (values plus elements) is not allowed. To be consistent with this principal SPASE should adopt a set of text normalization rules which will allow some structuring of textual content. This document describes a recommended set of text normalization rules and demonstrates how those rules can be used in practice.
